chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven E. Knight was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant may have early discharge from probation any time after 1 year if deemed appropriate by Agent.

miscConds.notes:
Shall maintain absolute sobriety - no alcohol or illegal drugs. 
Shall not possess or consume any controlled substance or paraphernalia, including syringes, without a valid prescription. 
Shall not have contact with any known drug users or dealers except in a treatment type setting.
AODA Assessment & follow-thru with any recommended treatment or counseling.

Any Assessments and Counseling as recommended by DOC. 
Random Urine Testing. 
DNA Sample/Surcharge - no sample necessary if previously provided. 
ALL FINANCIAL OBLIGATIONS IN THIS CASE WILL BE PAID DIRECTLY TO THE CALUMET COUNTY CLERK OF COURT OFFICE AND NOT YOUR PROBATION AGENT.  If you are not able to pay in full within 60 days, please call 920-849-1414 and speak to the Account Clerk to establish a payment plan.  Probation Agent is responsible to monitor ongoing payments to make sure all obligations are paid as a part of probation conditions.
If financial obligations are not paid in full and you have not contacted the Clerk of Court Office within 60 days, a civil judgment shall be entered against you for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect this debt, including sending unpaid obligations to the State Debt Collection Agency.
